bill_title: revise certain township powers related to water and sewerage systems.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain township powers related to water and sewerage systems. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 8-2-8 be amended to read as follows: 8-2-8. Each organized township in the state has power, when may, if an unincorporated town is within its limits: (1) To regulate Regulate the laying of sidewalks and crosswalks along, over, or across the streets and alleys thereof of the unincorporated town ; (2) To regulate Regulate the depositing of garbage, ashes, offal, or any offensive matter which might endanger the health of its inhabitants; (3) To prohibit Prohibit within the limits of such the unincorporated town the use of dangerous or defective stovepipes or chimneys; (4) To abate Abate any nuisance found within its corporate limits; (5) To provide Provide for the purchase and operation of such appliances as may be needed to protect the property of its inhabitants from fire; (6) To provide Provide for planting and caring for shade trees along the streets and on public squares or grounds of such the unincorporated town; (7) To grant Grant franchises and rights to persons, associations, or corporations , for the sale of electric current , or for the erection of lampposts, electric towers, light or powerlines, or other apparatus; (8) To authorize Authorize and regulate the erection and maintenance of street lamps, but the township shall may incur no expense for such erection or maintenance; (9) To vote Vote any appropriation necessary for providing a jail , and prescribe such regulations as may be necessary regarding the same jail . Any civil township providing such a jail shall cause notice of the same provision of the jail to be published in the newspaper having the largest circulation in such the township, if there be any, or cause the township clerk to post notice therefor of the provision of the jail in three of the most public places in the township; (10) To construct Construct , operate, equip, maintain, extend, and improve any system or part of a system of waterworks and sewers for supplying water and sewerage services for an unincorporated town within its boundaries for industrial , agricultural, and domestic use therein , for such compensation and terms and conditions as it may determine; (11) To purchase Purchase , construct, maintain, operate, and lease parks and public recreational facilities when if approved by the voters as provided by subdivision 8-3- 2(8).

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain township powers related to water and sewerage systems. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 8-2-8 be amended to read as follows: 8-2-8. Each organized township in the state has power, when may, if an unincorporated town is within its limits: (1) To regulate Regulate the laying of sidewalks and crosswalks along, over, or across the streets and alleys thereof of the unincorporated town ; (2) To regulate Regulate the depositing of garbage, ashes, offal, or any offensive matter which might endanger the health of its inhabitants; (3) To prohibit Prohibit within the limits of such the unincorporated town the use of dangerous or defective stovepipes or chimneys; (4) To abate Abate any nuisance found within its corporate limits; (5) To provide Provide for the purchase and operation of such appliances as may be needed to protect the property of its inhabitants from fire; (6) To provide Provide for planting and caring for shade trees along the streets and on public squares or grounds of such the unincorporated town; (7) To grant Grant franchises and rights to persons, associations, or corporations , for the sale of electric current , or for the erection of lampposts, electric towers, light or powerlines, or other apparatus; (8) To authorize Authorize and regulate the erection and maintenance of street lamps, but the township shall may incur no expense for such erection or maintenance; (9) To vote Vote any appropriation necessary for providing a jail , and prescribe such regulations as may be necessary regarding the same jail . Any civil township providing such a jail shall cause notice of the same provision of the jail to be published in the newspaper having the largest circulation in such the township, if there be any, or cause the township clerk to post notice therefor of the provision of the jail in three of the most public places in the township; (10) To construct Construct , operate, equip, maintain, extend, and improve any system or part of a system of waterworks and sewers for supplying water and sewerage services for an unincorporated town within its boundaries and the geographic area surrounding the unincorporated town, for industrial , agricultural, and domestic use therein , and for such compensation and terms and conditions as it may determine , provided that no system may be constructed, equipped, maintained, extended, or improved more than twenty miles from its exterior boundaries ; (11) To purchase Purchase , construct, maintain, operate, and lease parks and public recreational facilities when if approved by the voters as provided by subdivision 8-3- 2(8).
